      • getReloadPrice

        public Ammo getReloadPrice()
        Returns:
        the price to reload the ammo, as indicated in the top-left corner of the card

      • getDrawPrice

        Returns:
        the price to draw the ammo

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()

      • load

        public void load​(Ammo ammo,
                 PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
        Removes the necessary ammos from the "ammo" param to reload the card. You can check if you have enough ammo to reload by calling canReload(ammo) method
        Parameters:
        ammo - the ammo the player has, the reload cost will be deducted from here. ATTENTION: this function modifies the param
        Throws:
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the given ammo is not enough to reload.

      • canReload

        public boolean canReload​(Ammo ammo,
                         java.util.List<PowerUpCard> powerUpCards)
        Parameters:
        ammo - your ammo availability
        powerUpCards - PowerUp cards you can pay with
        Returns:
        true if the provided ammos are enough to reload.

      • canReload

        public boolean canReload​(Ammo ammo,
                         PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
        Parameters:
        ammo - your ammo availability
        powerUpCard - the PowerUp card you want to pay with
        Returns:
        true if the provided ammos are enough to reload.

      • canDraw

        public boolean canDraw​(Ammo ammo,
                       java.util.List<PowerUpCard> powerUpCards)
        Check that you have enough money to draw the card

        public boolean canDraw​(Ammo ammo,
                       PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
        Check that you have enough money to draw the card

      • activate

        public void activate()
        If the card is loaded, activate it and unload it
        Specified by:
        activate in class EffectCard
        Throws:
        WeaponCardException - if the weapon is already active
        UnloadedWeaponException - if the weapon is not loaded
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if player is null

      • getEffects

        public LegitEffects getEffects​(Ammo ammo,
                               java.util.List<PowerUpCard> powerUpCards)
        Get all effects, with a TRUE flag on the ones that can be used. The card must have been activated to get any activable effect
        Parameters:
        ammo - your ammo
        Returns:
        all the effects with the flag set to false if the card has not been activated

      • getEffectByName

        public Effect getEffectByName​(java.lang.String name)

      • playEffect

        public void playEffect​(Effect effect,
                       Ammo ammo,
                       PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
        Activates the chosen effect, paying it with the ammos given as param
        Parameters:
        effect - the effect to play
        ammo - ATTENTION: this param will be modified if the effect activation was successfull. The effect price will be deducted from it
        Throws:
        WeaponCardException - if you do not have enough ammo to activate the effect

      • playNextAction

        public Action playNextAction()
        activates the next action inside the effect. Must be called for the first action too. It also cancels the active effect and action if there are no more actions. In this case, on the last call it returned null
        Specified by:
        playNextAction in class EffectCard
        Returns:
        the action that has just been activated, or null if there are no more actions
        Throws:
        NoActiveEffectException - if no effect is active at the moment
